name: The Spatial and Temporal Diffusion of Agricultural Land Prices

author.name: Xinyue Yang
author.affiliation: Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin, Faculty of Life Sciences, Department of Agricultural Economics, Berlin, Germany

author.name: Martin Odening
author.affiliation: Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin, Faculty of Life Sciences, Department of Agricultural Economics, Berlin, Germany

author.name: Matthias Ritter
author.affiliation: Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin, Faculty of Life Sciences, Department of Agricultural Economics, Berlin, Germany

publisher.name: Board of Regents of the University of Wisconsin System
Board of Regents of the University of Wisconsin System

abstract: In the last decade, many parts of the world experienced severe increases in agricultural land prices. This price surge, however, did not take place evenly in space and time. To better understand the spatial and temporal behavior of land prices, we employ a price diffusion model that combines features of market integration models and spatial econometric models. An application of this model to farmland prices in Germany shows that prices on a county-level are cointegrated. Apart from convergence toward a long-run equilibrium, we find that price transmission experiences short-term adjustments caused by neighboring regions.
subject: Agricultural Economics
Land Economics
license: © 2019 by the Board of Regents of the University of Wisconsin System
citation: Yang, X., Odening, M., & Ritter, M. (2019). The Spatial and Temporal Diffusion of Agricultural Land Prices. Land Economics, 95(1), 108-123.

dataset.name: Farmland Prices in Lower Saxony, Germany
dataset.description: Dataset containing records of individual land sale transactions for arable land from January 1985 to December 2015 in Lower Saxony, Germany.
dataset.conditions_of_access: Data available upon request from the authors
